The efficiency of one — the talent of three. Why look further?

A frontend developer with a strong sense of form and attention to detail. I blend technical precision, interface aesthetics, and user experience to build solutions that don’t just work — they impress.

I’m a frontend developer specializing in high-performance, visually expressive web applications using Vue 3, Nuxt, TypeScript, and modern tools like Three.js, WebGL, and SVG. I actively participate in hackathons and programming competitions.

I don’t offer formal courses, but I’m happy to share useful resources, architectural advice, or help troubleshoot specific technical challenges—especially those involving Vue, Nuxt, or visual effects.
I work as an independent developer. Collaboration can be one-off (e.g., implementing a complex interactive feature) or long-term—within a team or during a hackathon.
How long does a task take?
Simple components or effects take a few hours to a couple of days. Full projects (e.g., a landing page with custom animations) typically take one to four weeks.
I’m open to flexible terms for educational initiatives, student projects, and non-profit teams.

The ability to build complex, beautiful, and fast interfaces from pure code. I’m especially drawn to challenges where frontend meets graphics, animation, or real-time rendering—like visualizations, shaders, and WebGL.
What do you do outside of coding?
I take part in hackathons, experiment with new APIs, and follow trends in web graphics. I’m also passionate about sports—I regularly hit the gym.
